citeinfo.origin: The North Carolina Department of Transportation Geographic Information Systems Unit
citeinfo.title: Smooth Boundary Layer

pubinfo.publish: The North Carolina Department of Transportation Geographic Information Systems Unit

descript.abstract:
Smooth Bounday represents the Urban Area boundaries (urbanized and small urban) of North Carolina. The boundaries were originally generated by the Census in 2000 and have been adjusted (smoothed) by the Trasnportation Planning Branch of the North Carolina Department of Transportation.
Road within the Smooth Boundary are considered Urban; roads outside are considered rural.
descript.purpose:
This dataset was developed to represent the boundary line between urban and rural functional classification lines.
It is used for HPMS reporting.
descript.supplinf:
This layer should be submitted to FHWA as part of the HPMS reporting process each year if there have been changes to the boundary since the previous year.
Roads within a polygon feature are considered urban. This layer should not be confused with municipal boundaries or MPO boundaries. Although they are similar and identical in some cases, the Smooth Boundary layer is officially changed by the Census every 10 years. The Municipal Boundaries layer is updated annually. There may be cases when a road is within a large city's limits, but still be considered rural because it is outside of the Smooth Boundary.
The internal owner of this data is Transportation Planning Branch. NCDOT GIS Unit has added value to the layer by maintaining these fields: Type, RUID, POP_EST, POP_EST_YR, and by updating the metadata.
This layer is used by the Spatially Derived component of the ARID Maintenance Process. Any changes to this layer needs to be communicated to the owner of the program.

procstep.procdesc: Smooth boundary lines were based on the existing road inventory maps.
Smooth boundary lines were translated into coverage format and built as polygons. Labels were generated and polygons were checked for errors.
The coverage format was converted to a shapefile for customer distribution.
Boundaries were adjusted by the Transportation Planning Branch so that federal-aid roads were not weaving in and out of the boundary. Edits were reviewed by the NCDOT GIS Unit.
Field was added to the attribute table by Transportation Planning Branch to track the FHWA 5 digit Census code.
Population Estimates generated by the NCDOT GIS Unit Spatial Analysis Section for HPMS were added to the attribute table.
Metadata updated by NCDOT GIS Unit.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Type of area enclosed by polygons - Urban Cluster, Urbanized Area

edom.edomvd: Area enclosed by adjacent urbanized boundary types, but not included in them

attr.attrdef: Legacy Universe codes used to identify each area.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Department of Transportation Geographic Information Systems Unit
